name: sedec
tagline: The sedec(=SEction coDEC) is module to encode/decode and also transcode section(ISO-13818).
body:
# What is sedec? The sedec(=SEction coDEC) is a library to encode/decode and also transcode section(ISO-13818),
Especiall for AIT(=Application Information Table) of HbbTV 1.5/2.0. The input of sedec is raw AIT table(Not section to be seperated)
And output is abstractive AIT object. User application can achieve all of information that AIT has. # Architecture ## - Block diagram (ASAP) ## - Class diagram (ASAP) # How to build Build tree are compose of followings: 
.
├── CMakeLists.txt
├── LICENSE
├── README.md
├── build (Directory you will may create)
├── examples (This has samples of decoder/encoder)
├── release (Directory to release to cross platforms)
└── sedec(Sedec sources)
You can meet library(libsedec) in build/out directory after following build command.
And thus there are examples, e.g. decoder, encoder. 
#mkdir build
#cd build
#cmake ..
#make
# How to port your project Please follow below examples # Examples ## Decoder There are executable binary to decode AIT(table, not section) in build/out You can output result of AIT information like following. 
#cd build/out
#decoder_example ./example_ait.dump
[main                ]***************************
[main                ]* Section Decoding Sample *
[main                ]***************************

## Encoder Thie example encoder's real operation is to trascode from original AIT to modified AIT.
The way to run same as decoder example, but it has to check sources how example can transcode original AIT. 
#encoder_example original_ait
#decoder_example modified_ait // you can see information if transcoding work out well.
